articles.author: Will Dunham
articles.description: Jimmy Carter, the earnest Georgia peanut farmer who as U.S. president struggled with a bad economy and the Iran hostage crisis but brokered peace between Israel and Egypt and later received the Nobel Peace Prize for his humanitarian work, died at his home in Plains, Georgia, on Sunday, the Carter Center said. He was 100.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter, former US president and Nobel Peace Prize recipient, dead at 100

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 28 people were killed when an airliner went off the runway and slammed into a wall at South Korea's Muan International Airport on Sunday, Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: At least 28 dead in fiery aircraft crash in South Korea, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Cynthia Kim
articles.description: When South Korea's acting President Choi Sang-mok arrived at the scene of the deadliest air disaster on the country's soil on Sunday, he had been on the job for less than 48 hours.
articles.title: Air crash tests South Korea's acting president two days into the job

articles.author: Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: Azerbaijan on Sunday paid tribute to the pilots and passengers of the Azerbaijan Airlines passenger plane that crashed in Kazakhstan killing 38 people after Russian air defences were used against Ukrainian drones.
articles.title: Azerbaijan pays tribute to pilots and passengers who perished in air crash

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces carrying out a weeks-long offensive in northern Gaza ordered any residents remaining in Beit Hanoun to quit the town on Sunday, pointing to Palestinian militant rocket fire from the area, residents said.
articles.title: Israeli forces order new evacuation at besieged northern Gaza town, residents say

articles.author: Moira Warburton
articles.description: Former U.S. President Jimmy Carter died at age 100, the Atlanta Journal-Constitution reported on Sunday. Here are several key events from the Georgia Democrat's time in office from 1977 to 1981.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter's biggest challenges while president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is in good condition and fully conscious after his prostate surgery ended "successfully," his office said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel PM Netanyahu is in good condition, fully conscious after successful prostate surgery, his office says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Incumbent president Zoran Milanovic, the opposition Socialist Democrats' candidate, was on track to win a second term of office in the first round of Croatia's presidential election on Sunday, the State Electoral Commission said.
articles.title: Incumbent Milanovic on track to win Croatia's presidential election

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: Authorities in Moldova's separatist Transdniestria region on Sunday cut off gas supplies to several state institutions as a deal allowing Russian gas to transit through Ukraine comes to an end at the close of the year.
articles.title: Moldova's separatist region cuts gas as Ukraine transit deal runs out

articles.author: Gleb Stolyarov, Felix Light
articles.description: Mikheil Kavelashvili, a hardline critic of the West, was sworn in as president of Georgia on Sunday amid a political crisis after the government froze European Union application talks in a move that sparked major protests.
articles.title: New Georgian president sworn in; predecessor says he is not legitimate leader
